conclusion: Summarize the plan to solve the problem by describing the image, analyzing the motion, and calculating the time.
The image shows two uniform magnetic fields separated by line MN with magnetic induction intensities B1 and B2. A particle with charge +q and mass m enters B1 perpendicularly at point O.
The relationship B1 = 2B2 is given, indicating B1 is twice as strong as B2.
The particle's velocity v is perpendicular to the magnetic field B1.
The force on the particle due to the magnetic field is F = qvB1.
The particle's acceleration is a = qvB1/m.
Since B1 = 2B2, the acceleration in B1 is twice the acceleration in B2.
As the particle moves downward, its velocity decreases due to the decelerating magnetic force.
When the particle reaches point O, it will again experience the magnetic force F due to B1.
The time t taken for the particle to pass through point O downward again is determined using the equation of motion: t = 2mv/qB1.
Since the particle returns to point O, the time taken is t = mv/qB2.
